_exit1: A way out of a building, room, or passenger vehicle.
_exit2: An act of leaving a place.
_danger1: The possibility of suffering harm or injury.
_help1: Make it easier or possible for (someone) to do something by offering them one's services or resources.
_help2: (help oneself) Serve someone with (food or drink)
_help3: (can/could not help oneself) Cannot or could not avoid.
_price1: The amount of money expected, required, or given in payment for something.
_price2: An unwelcome experience or action undergone or done as a condition of achieving an objective.
_far1: At, to, or by a great distance (used to indicate the extent to which one thing is distant from another)
_far2: Over a large expanse of space or time.
_close1: Only a short distance away or apart in space or time.
_close2: Denoting a family member who is part of a person's immediate family, typically a parent or sibling.
_close3: (of observation, examination, etc.) done in a careful and thorough way.
_store1: A quantity or supply of something kept for use as needed.
_store2: A shop of any size or kind.
_store3: A sheep, steer, cow, or pig acquired or kept for fattening.
_supermarket1: A large self-service shop selling foods and household goods.
